1385799215469707265.text: Attending West Point is not easy, but students are determined no matter the challenge. We visited USMAPS, an on-campus preparatory school. It accepts soldiers and other students from diverse backgrounds and challenges, and helps them meet and exceed rigorous admissions standards. https://t.co/gYmnWZuagG

1385789893570408449.text: A lot of our discussions focused on Army and USMA budget priorities. We analyzed a range of topics, including strategies for enhancing readiness and capabilities, as well as infrastructure and facility rehabilitation plans for Camp Buckner and Camp Natural Bridge training areas.

1385787677971304458.text: Cadets at @WestPoint_USMA are tested on all levels. We watched as USMA Black vs. USMA Gold teams competed against each other in a Sandhurst Crucible rematch event. The obstacle course tests military mobility and tactics. Earlier this month Black won, but Gold took it today! https://t.co/CxtQKfuIIV

1385698458049433606.text: It’s always inspiring to see the young men & women who’ve made a choice to serve. We had lunch with cadets from all areas represented by members—Arkansas, Oklahoma, California, Texas, Alabama, and Florida. They’ve gone from receiving a congressional nomination to becoming cadets! https://t.co/6sFecUAknW

1385690297879904268.text: Academics are a major component of @WestPoint_USMA’s mission of training and shaping a strong military. @KenCalvert @RepRutherfordFL @RepMikeRogersAL @RepBice and I joined cadets in the classroom for lessons on military leadership, politics, and international relations. https://t.co/QoT2rsDwLM

1385621380226498570.text: Boxing is a mandatory part of the curriculum. Cadets are taught offensive and defensive skills of amateur boxing. They’re trained in stances, movement, and punches—and then evaluated in the ring! This exposes them to defense techniques and prepares them for physical threats. https://t.co/699ys48h8c

1385611856337833988.text: We watched Cadet Sydney Cassalia and Cadet Matthew Bassette navigate all the obstacles. Their performance was impressive to say the least. They demonstrated excellence and skill at every point. These young leaders are the future of our Army. @WestPoint_USMA https://t.co/Qixvq3h0XS

1385611843465580550.text: IOCT is a series of obstacles assessing agility, strength, technique, and cardio capacity. The course includes a low crawl under a barrier, tire footwork, a two-handed vault, maneuvering over an 8 foot horizontal shelf, balance beam, ladder, vertical rope, sprinting, and more. https://t.co/uhFQYX6OdN

1385611771357110275.text: Next, we observed the Indoor Obstacle Course Test (IOCT), a full-body and grueling physical fitness evaluation. Initiated in 1944 during #WWII, the IOCT was created through lessons learned during the war as a comprehensive measurement of a cadet's physical ability. #WestPoint https://t.co/OMlL3NwMFD

1385596058483499013.text: During this unique and challenging training, these future soldiers experience swimming in uniform and boots, while holding tactical gear. It physically tests them, and they also practice fear management and breath control. It’s about preparing them for a life-or-death scenario. https://t.co/f7zaMUGslZ

1385595508287315971.text: We started our morning at Arvin Cadet Physical Development Center to see different aspects of physical training. Here you will see cadets participating in survival swimming instruction. @WestPoint_USMA https://t.co/dQvZ8AoLCB

1156321827918176262.text: Finishing up a roundtable at Arkansas Children's Northwest @archildrens, where we discussed the importance of vaccines and the need to combat misinformation related to medicine. Vaccines are critical to stopping certain disease outbreaks and protecting the health of communities. https://t.co/sZQdWgSnnc

1156317765768286210.text: Our children are the future of Arkansas and America. @archildrens Northwest provides outstanding care to #AR3, and I made sure to take @CDCDirector for a tour of the hospital. On the way in, we saw the Bland family and Jack Walker of @JDRF & talked about diabetes and research. https://t.co/NOKAKpfBtX

1156299440631758850.text: NEXT STOP→Benton County Health Unit for a meeting with the Arkansas Department of Health & #AR3 medical and health directors. Informative discussions on AIDS and HIV care, delivery of general medicine, and health programs for our local Marshallese communities. https://t.co/adKH0Lvcks

1156267340855750656.text: Great to have @CDCDirector Redfield join the @RogersRotary to learn more about #AR3 and talk with residents. Important conversations about local public health priorities, as well as strategies to meet challenges and enhance health and safety on local, state, and federal levels. https://t.co/la5C1PVPah

1156224410363342850.text: Starting off the morning at KURM Radio. Discussing public health, the work of the CDC, opioid addiction epidemic, and initiatives to address HIV and other diseases with @CDCDirector Dr. Robert Redfield. Important @cdcgov insights - listen live: https://t.co/OHnKVNDahq https://t.co/9wEs6EcZcr

1155939829940535297.text: It has been a busy summer in DC! We've had hundreds of #AR3 residents stop by for Capitol tours, and we would love to show you around! If you are planning to visit DC, please call my office at 202-225-4301 to schedule a Capitol tour and learn more about other sights to explore. https://t.co/vE13fsv5PK

1155918738694266880.text: Happy #NationalChickenWingDay! Did you know that poultry is the leading agricultural industry in Arkansas? In fact, #AR3 Washington and Benton counties produce the most poultry in Arkansas!

1155258738623860737.text: Watching NBC only to hear Alma, AR mentioned. Carrie Jernigan of Alma bought every shoe from Payless during a going-out-of-business sale. Her plan is to donate the shoes to those in need in the community. An amazing gesture that will support so many! https://t.co/GXte42o1Gr

1154861013822558209.text: Had the privilege of speaking to Navy Ensign Justin Lee Archer before our flight. He was just commissioned this morning in Newport, RI & is a 2006 graduate of Elkins HS. He’s taken an oath to defend our nation, no matter the sacrifice. Arkansas thanks him for his service! 🇺🇸 #AR3 https://t.co/DgN8srUxSc

1154529501834907648.text: One of the best parts of my job is getting to spend time w/ America’s future leaders. Grateful to the summer interns in my DC and district offices & all the interns who have been part of #TeamWomack through the years! Thank you for your work on behalf of #AR3. #NationalInternDay https://t.co/FBWEOuLEG1

1154506817738878976.text: Congrats to @ArmyChiefStaff General Mark Milley on being confirmed as Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. America and our troops will be well served by Gen. Milley's integrity, leadership, and experience. He is a patriot of the highest standard - I thank him for his service. https://t.co/q9HHoodmp4

1154401548631457792.text: In partnership with the State of Arkansas, FEMA is hiring workers across the state for a variety of jobs to help support residents and communities recovering from recent storms and flooding. Learn more about the opportunities by clicking the link. https://t.co/55DjDxJqXM

1154163702180057089.text: Today, the House came together to honor fallen Capitol Police Officer Jacob Chestnut and Detective John Gibson. They gave all defending the Capitol from an armed gunman in 1998. We will never forget their commitment to protecting and serving or their sacrifice. Grateful for USCP. https://t.co/z8ttcSLB8R

1154143764635668484.text: Residents in Sebastian County and the surrounding areas who are rebuilding or repairing their homes after recent devastating floods can receive free hazard mitigation consultation from FEMA representatives at the Lowe's in Fort Smith. More info found below. #AR3 https://t.co/gHfkBdWCWK

1154057512188108807.text: Great to speak with members of Arkansas Farm Credit this morning about the importance of the #USMCA and also talk about budget + appropriations updates. Agriculture is critical to the strength of #AR3 and our state, and I am proud that @FarmCreditWEAR is located in Russellville! https://t.co/sI6XBNqfk6

1154037670676271105.text: What have I heard from Arkansas farmers, businesses and workers in #AR3? Pass the #USMCA. It’s critical for economic growth, job opportunities and market access. It's time for a vote that allows reps to show the American people where they stand on this vital trade deal. #USMCAnow https://t.co/TuQnh7KxGM

1153833249535217664.text: My condolences to the family of Joye Kelley. Joye devoted her life to community & education - impacting many through her more than two decades as an educator and Rogers School Board member & president. Her legacy is the excellence displayed by our schools. May she rest in peace.

1153718817555701760.text: Congrats to @EsperDoD on being confirmed as our nation’s next Secretary of Defense. He is an inspired choice who will lead the @DeptofDefense with distinction, skill, and strength. I look forward to working together to support our troops & keep our country safe. Full statement ⬇️ https://t.co/8KQdyaWUg0
